item.title: [BENARAS] Benares Hotels Ltd Appoints Sumit Singh Deol as Chief Executive Officer (CEO) w.e.f. 24.02.2026
item.description:
Benares Hotels Ltd announced the appointment of Mr. Sumit Singh Deol as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Key Managerial Personnel (KMP) of the company, effective from February 24, 2026. The appointment was made during a board meeting, based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee. Mr. Deol is an experienced professional in the field of Food & Beverage and General Management, having worked with IHCL since 2010. He has been recognized with various awards for his contributions.

item.title: [CYIENT] Cyient Foundation Recognises Student Innovations at Pitch Fest 2026 with Cash Awards
item.description:
The Cyient Foundation Pitch Fest 2026, organized in partnership with ICT Academy, brought together promising student entrepreneurs from leading engineering institutions across Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. The initiative witnessed an enthusiastic response, with over 2,000 students from 40 colleges participating. Following multiple rounds of evaluation and live pitching before an eminent jury, five outstanding ideas were selected as winners, with each winning team receiving a cash award in recognition of their innovation and entrepreneurial spirit.

item.title: [SPARC] Sun Pharma Advanced Research Company Ltd Addendum to Valuation Report
item.description:
Sun Pharma Advanced Research Company Ltd has submitted an addendum to the valuation report in response to a query from the National Stock Exchange of India. The addendum clarifies certain points in the original valuation report, including the scope of information and the reasoning for not using the Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) method. The company's operations, which are predominantly focused on pre-clinical research, clinical trial execution, and development of novel pharmaceutical technologies, make it difficult to project future cash flows reliably. The company does not have an established or recurring revenue generating business model, and any income from R&D outcomes is inherently uncertain. The management has not furnished any financial projections for the company, making the DCF method inappropriate for valuing the company.

  • Addendum to the Valuation Report submitted to the National Stock Exchange of India
  • Clarifications provided in response to a query from the National Stock Exchange of India
  • Difficulty in projecting future cash flows due to the nature of the company's operations
  • Lack of an established or recurring revenue generating business model
  • Inappropriateness of the DCF method for valuing the company due to the lack of predictable future revenues

item.title: [CPPLUS] Aditya Infotech Ltd Promoters Plan to Sell 2% Shares to Comply with Minimum Public Shareholding
item.description:
Aditya Infotech Ltd promoters, Hari Khemka Business Family Trust and Mr. Rishi Khemka, have expressed their intention to sell Equity Shares of the Company to meet the minimum public shareholding requirements. The proposed sale will involve up to 2% of the total paid-up equity share capital, amounting to 23,55,961 shares, within a period starting from February 25, 2026, and ending on March 05, 2026, or earlier, depending on the completion of the sale. The current promoter and promoter group shareholding stands at 76.74% of the total paid-up equity share capital.

  • Aditya Infotech Ltd promoters plan to sell Equity Shares to meet minimum public shareholding requirements.
  • The proposed sale involves up to 2% of the total paid-up equity share capital, amounting to 23,55,961 shares.
  • The sale period is set to begin on February 25, 2026, and end on March 05, 2026, or earlier.
  • The current promoter and promoter group shareholding is 76.74% of the total paid-up equity share capital.
  • No promoter or promoter group member will buy shares in the open market during the sale period.

item.title: [ANGELONE] Angel One Ltd. Approves Allotment of 5,000 Non-Convertible Debentures worth INR 50 Crore
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Angel One Ltd. announced the allotment of 5,000 Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) worth INR 50 Crore. The NCDs, having a face value of INR 1,00,000 each, will be listed on the Wholesale Debt Market Segment of the National Stock Exchange of India Limited (NSE). The tenure of the instrument is 18 months, with the first coupon to be paid on August 25, 2026, and the principal to be redeemed on August 25, 2027. The company has created a first pari-passu charge by way of hypothecation over all present and future trade receivables and loans in the form of margin trading facilities of the Company.

item.title: [UMAEXPORTS] Uma Exports Ltd: Non-Executive Non-Independent Director, Ms. Mansi Khemka, Resigns Effective February 24, 2026
item.description:
Uma Exports Ltd has announced the resignation of its Non-Executive Non-Independent Director, Ms. Mansi Khemka, with effect from the close of business hours on February 24, 2026. The resignation is due to her pre-occupancy in her own business ventures. Ms. Khemka confirmed that there are no other material reasons for her resignation. The company has provided the necessary details as per Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 and the Master Circular SEBI/HO/CFD/PoD2/CIR/P/0155 dated November 11, 2024.
